intro: Euphrasia sevanensis, commonly known as the Sevan eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Armenia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soil and full sun. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in racemes. Euphrasia sevanensis is notable for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional remedies.
